intro: Myosotis, commonly known as the forget-me-not, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Boraginaceae. These plants are characterized by their delicate blue or purple flowers, often with a white or yellow center, and heart-shaped leaves. Myosotis species are typically herbaceous, growing from 10 to 60 centimeters in height, and are found in temperate regions across the Northern Hemisphere. They thrive in moist, well-drained soils and are often found in meadows, woodlands, and along streams. The genus includes over 30 species, many of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
